code="2">star</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="520" ind1="3" ind2=" "><subfield code="a">The authors present measurements of the branching ratio and of the polarization amplitudes in charmless B{sub s} → φφ decays using data corresponding to 2.9 fb⁻¹ of integrated luminosity, collected by the CDF experiment at the Tevatron. The branching ratio in B{sub s} → φφ decays is measured relative to the normalization mode B{sub s} → J/Ψφ be Β(B{sub s} → φφ)/Β(B{sub s} → J/Ψφ) = [1.78 ± 0.14(stat) ± 0.20(syst)] x 10⁻². Using the experimental value of Β(B{sub s} → J/Ψφ) they determine the B{sub s} → φφ branching ratio Β(B{sub s} → φφ) = 2.40 ± 0.21(stat) ± 0.27(syst) ± 0.82(BR) x 10⁻⁵. The polarization fractions are measured for the first time in this analysis and found to be: </subfield><subfield code="a">₀</subfield><subfield code="a">{sub ∥}</subfield><subfield code="a">{sub ⊥}</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="536" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield code="b">AC02-07CH11359</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="650" ind1=" " ind2="7"><subfield code="a">Physics Of Elementary Free-to-read Unrestricted online access star The authors present measurements of the branching ratio and of the polarization amplitudes in charmless B{sub s} → φφ decays using data corresponding to 2.9 fb⁻¹ of integrated luminosity, collected by the CDF experiment at the Tevatron. The branching ratio in B{sub s} → φφ decays is measured relative to the normalization mode B{sub s} → J/Ψφ be Β(B{sub s} → φφ)/Β(B{sub s} → J/Ψφ) = [1.78 ± 0.14(stat) ± 0.20(syst)] x 10⁻². Using the experimental value of Β(B{sub s} → J/Ψφ) they determine the B{sub s} → φφ branching ratio Β(B{sub s} → φφ) = 2.40 ± 0.21(stat) ± 0.27(syst) ± 0.82(BR) x 10⁻⁵. The polarization fractions are measured for the first time in this analysis and found to be:  ₀ {sub ∥} {sub ⊥} AC02-07CH11359 Physics Of Elementary Particles And Fields. edbsc Amplitudes. notes_summary_ssim: The authors present measurements of the branching ratio and of the polarization amplitudes in charmless B{sub s} → φφ decays using data corresponding to 2.9 fb⁻¹ of integrated luminosity, collected by the CDF experiment at the Tevatron. The branching ratio in B{sub s} → φφ decays is measured relative to the normalization mode B{sub s} → J/Ψφ be Β(B{sub s} → φφ)/Β(B{sub s} → J/Ψφ) = [1.78 ± 0.14(stat) ± 0.20(syst)] x 10⁻². Using the experimental value of Β(B{sub s} → J/Ψφ) they determine the B{sub s} → φφ branching ratio Β(B{sub s} → φφ) = 2.40 ± 0.21(stat) ± 0.27(syst) ± 0.82(BR) x 10⁻⁵. The polarization fractions are measured for the first time in this analysis and found to be:  ₀ {sub ∥} {sub ⊥}
